Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great service, room had strong soiled odor.”
Reviews.Author: teddyedward666
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 or maybe 4 times now. Rooms are always well presented, staff are good, food is lovely. Last visit however my room stank of damp (actually it smelt like I was in my garden turnInf the compost. Internet is ok, not fast enough for Skype with video, and a bit lag-ish on voice only.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good service, poor location”
Reviews.Author: owenturney
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a a refreshing change from French novotels encountered on our trip south. Young, Energetic staff, lively atmosphere, friendly and decent food, although cooking is on the under rather than over side.. Including pink pork. I would have given 4 stars bar the location which is out of town right next to a major road with nowhere to walk to for a stretch of the legs. But for a stopover a decent choice...

Reviews.Title: “Charged but not booked”
Reviews.Author: Babanakov
Reviews.Content: Hotel charged my card prior to arrival but, when we arrived they told that they have no room for us. They booked us other Novotel in 10km away, and didn't suggest anything to compensate their mistake. I even had to remind them to return money, they charged.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: T_Virdee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is outside of the city centre and hence has good links to the highways. The reception is nicely laid out and has a very cool feeling about itself. The staff are warm and friendly and extremely helpful. The bathroom was clean and simple. The essentials are provided - bars of soap, body wash and shampoo. The rooms are of an average size. My hotel room had a bed, desk and a sofa. The rooms have a contemporary look and feel but still manage to maintain a 'homely' feel. The air conditioning unit in the room was great, at night time having set it to the lowest fan speed, it made very little noise. I did not find the bed overly comfortable and had trouble sleeping. Despite the size, the room did not have a great layout, where the placement for luggage storage was at the foot of the bed and gave little walk-way space. A safe is provided in the room and the area to hang clothes is basic. The hotel location and the room layout and facilities make it better suited to a business traveller rather than one going on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “very good price-quality”
Reviews.Author: Janine1973
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel, nothing special but with good service and clean rooms. We stayed here with our two children of 7 and 8 years old and they stayed here for free. For this, they had to sleep on a small couch, but was sufficient for their age. I expect the rooms to be a bit too small when they are over 8 and 9 years old. But again, we were very happy; good acces, good breakfast buffet, internet service, nice personell at the reception. For a few nights in Madrid fine place to stay for little money!

Reviews.Title: “close to Barajas”
Reviews.Author: Alex d
Reviews.Content: the best hotel , when you have to stay one night close to Barajas and minutes from el Corte Ingles in Sanchinarro, front desk excellent, Jesus, Marta, ..the best

Reviews.Title: “reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean, the hotel was located in a good place, just a bit far from metro by walking. I would stay in this hotel if I go to Madrid in future. I recommend this hotel to all my friends too.

Reviews.Title: “Best was desk to work on and WiFi”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The breakfast is too expensive, you can have the same in local cafes for less than half price. WiFi was very good compared to other hotels, and the room OK, only the bathtub was overflowing with silicone around all the joints. Minibar with a flat-fee price... everything 4€, even a bottle of water!

Reviews.Title: “Cost cutting a bridge too far!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Always stay here as it is very convenient for the motorway and onward travel. Disappointed this time to see paper cups on the hospitality tray and only 1 individual milk for tea and coffee, a cost cutting exercise too far given the price of the room would expect to be able to make at least 2 cups. Room very hot air conditioning not effective. Always very clean and staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “RIGHT SIDE OF THE HIGHWAY”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel rather difficult to find and so had to have a taxi driver help us to locate it. However we found the room very comfortable and the staff very helpful. The breakfast is excellent and value for money. We would have liked clearer instructions on how to walk to the nearest train station. At night the main entrance to the hotel is not very visible.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: helen b
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful, the pool area was great especially in August when we went, having towels provided round the pool was useful with kids meant no wet towels in the room. Its a little out of Madrid but we had a car which helped but I'm sure the staff would have helped with transport into Madrid. The bar and restaurant were a little pricey but comparative with other major city hotels. Overall a lovely stay and Madrid is a really beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Business travelling standard ++”
Reviews.Author: Dorotka_BS
Reviews.Content: Very positively surprised, after I was quoted ca 60 EUR [corporate rate] per night which is rather low in Madrid, I was expecting a dogdy accommodation, yet was presented with a clean bright room with all amenities you need to make yourself comfortable after a long day in the office. Very good size rooms, each with queen bed and a couch, spacious bathroom. Breakfast not included but you are given a choice between 3 kinds: tiny [croissant + hot beverage], continental or full. Service ok, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night because we could not reach our connecting flight. Professional and friendly check in close to midnight. Breakfast buffet nice considering that breakfast is not a big affear in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, modern, inexpensive hotel a bit out of the way of downtown Madrid and the airport”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked his Novotel by mistake thinking it was the one closest to the airport. The staff was so pleasant and helpful on the phone (in both English and Spanish) , that we kept the reservation. We needed two trains and a bus to get there from the airport and two buses to get back at night from our day in town. Our departure was a quick 15 minute cab ride to the airport on Saturday morning for around 25 euros with luggage. This modern Novotel had a modern, clean and comfortable double room for us. A favorite feature was the deep bathtub where my friend took a comfortable and leisurely bath. I can vouch for the shower which had great pressure,quick hot water and didn't get water on the floor, possibly because of the deep tub. The bathroom was very clean. One thing to look out for is the door stop for the bathroom door which is a round metal cylinder located right in front of the toilet. It is easy to stub your toes on it. In fact my friend did that. The air conditioner didn't work right and we slept with the window open. We were there just one night so it wasn't a big deal. My friend found the fan noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good clean hotel close to the airport, convenient for late night flights and heading up to the mountains. Parking was quite expensive though.

Reviews.Title: “Tired decor. Not for the business traveler. Young & Ignorant staff.”
Reviews.Author: Jylland_Mande
Reviews.Content: My company selected this hotel, presumably, because it is within 5 minutes walking distance. Other than that, nothing to recommend. Examples: Built in the 1970's during the Novotel "concept". Personally, I am tired of the extensive use of reds, oranges and burnt browns. Except for missing the green shag carpets - well suited to people of an "Elvis" flavor. Little to no sound-proofing. Internet is 3MB TOTAL shared among 150 rooms on a less than robust tertiary line per the ISP (N2S , Power2Hotel). Restaurant closes on two days at a time with little to no warning. Dinner does not open until 7:30. The shopping district is NOT within walking distance if you have to carry anything back. Staff member recommended going to the City Center on Sunday - forgetting to mention that he was there the day before and had to return home because of no parking. That was quite a frustrating 2 hour FUBAR for me that could have been avoided. The hotel HVAC is mostly out of service. Cold on one side ofthe hotel, hot on the other. The controls on the wall are dummies - only control a fan motor (when it works). Mold in the bathrooms around the tubs, etc. Yuck! No fitness center. Near impossible parking AT hotel. My E320 Mercedes barely made the corners into the garage (3" max to spare on each side). The primary entrance to the garage is a one lane channel. Constantly had to back-up or wait for the other party to get in or out. Just across from the regional hospital - with cars everywhere parked. There was no street with two usable lanes - cars simply parked whereever they wanted to. Hotel street deadends - and there is some interesting graffitti if you are into that sort of art (not what I like to look at from my hotel window, however).

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel in Sanchinarro / Las Tablas area of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: CarynWaller
Reviews.Content: I stay here regularly on business as it is conveniently located for both my companies Madrid offices as well as our clients. The location is perfect for business but not for much else I imagine being situation in the heart of the business area of Madrid near in Sanchinarro and Las Tablas. Rooms are clean with a good TV with 'movies on demand' in several languages, air conditioner, mini bar and wifi. Bathrooms also spacious, clean and really good. Staff are super friendly and speak many languages. There is a small pool, not suitable for pounding out lengths but certainly ok for cooling off and sunbathing. The restaurant is good. Room service is limited which is my only disappointment with this place as after a long day in meetings sometimes you just want to eat in your room. If you want a decent meal the restaurant is a must. The value for money is great too - not expensive and when my business trip was cut short by a day, even though I had booked online and in advance with the super cheap rate - they couldn't refund me but gave me a 90Euro voucher off my next vist which I later used.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, awful location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCelt
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is a typical Novotel: I found the room quite comfortable and the food from room service adequate. Like all such hotels it is completely devoid of character, but when traveling for business that is not really important. However, the location is real problem. Accessing it from the A1 southbound involves driving on some small and heavily congested roads. Accessing the M40 westbound from the hotel is also very difficult. The location is so bad that I won't be staying there again. If you want to stay in this style of hotel in this part of Madrid I'd recommend the Novotel near the airport instead.

Reviews.Title: “A good alternative”
Reviews.Author: Supermercado
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for a long and sunny week end. We know Madrid very well so we did not really need to stay in a more central place. If you are a tourist traveller visiting Madrid for the first time, this hotel is not for you. Although it is close to Chamartin, it is a bit tricky to get there without a car but there are plenty of buses to the main metro stations, so it is fairly convenient anyway. This hotel is a typical new, modern Novotel, with Novation rooms and design. No fantasy, but good and efficient design and comfortable overall with nice materials. There is a small pool and a beautiful outside terrace which is great for evening drinks. Armchairs abd lightnings were great. Breakfast was horrible (and really on the pricey side), so I would not recommend it to anyone. First, since they have good deals for the week end, the hotel is filled with noisy families travelling by bus who regard the breakfast room as a playground, which makes eating here a very unpleasant experience. The selection of items is rather poor (I am used to better breakfasts at Novotel) with hardly any refills in case you arrive late. Eventually, due to the lack of staff, there was only one waitress there, which means she hardly could clean tables and refill food at the same time (took ages to get what we wanted). This hotel is however a good alternative if you can get cheap rates and do not mind spending 40 minutes or so to get to central Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, dreadful location”
Reviews.Author: zardoz1
Reviews.Content: I had much the same experience as the "miles from nowhere" review posted above. The hotel is new, so is all neat, clean and comfortable. The design is anonymous modernity that could be in any city; once inside, only the language reminds you that you are actually in Spain. Everything seemed overpriced, from the pay TV to the (certainly quite nice) meals in the restaurant. Breakfast was excellent, but they do charge you for it. The staff were helpful and they all spoke very good English. Outside the hotel you find modern Madrid at its worst - freeways, building sites, office blocks that, again, look like every other city's modern office blocks. There is no metro station nearby. It cost me 9 euros by taxi to get to the centre of the city. Sanchinarro is clearly an office/industrial zone and not a residential area, let alone an entertainment precinct. The room seemed to me to be of a good size, and my air-conditioning did work. You will need the aircon; opening the window would let in the noise from the freeway outside. Finally the price I paid on checking out was not the price quoted when I booked it. I was there on business so none of the above bothered me too much, but if I was a tourist I think I would have been disappointed, despite the comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Miles From Nowhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was recommended to stay at the Novotel Sanchinarro because it is very near to the company offices where I would be working. The hotel is very new and from the outside looks quite impressive. The rooms are clean and I must admit quite comfortable although there is very little wardrobe space and no drawers at all. The TV offers very limited English language viewing and movies are available in the room for a staggering €15 per film. The air conditioning in the hotel is certainly of poor quality and during my stay complained many times about the high temperature. I was shown another three rooms and in each room the air conditioning was also not working. The only solution for a comfortable night was to open the window the small amount it is able but results in a every early awakening by the refuse collectors who seem to make as much noise as they possibly can!!! The hotel restaraunt although does indeed look good does not offer a varied menu and is not very good value at the prices charged. That may explain why nobody was using it. The hotel location is terrible for access into Madrid. There is no Metro train station anywhere near the hotel and bus rides are the only option which can unfortunately take forever during the rush hour when the roads are very busy. Taxi's are available but again quite expensive and the drivers tend to speak very little English. Walking around the Sanchinarro area is a complete waste of time as all that you can see are building sites where you tend to get completely covered in mud or the local superstore. There are no other dining facilities or bars in the vacinity of the hotel and so the nights can be long and boring unless travel is made into Madrid itself. Finally, the hotel told me the room rate was €79 per night which I though was very expensive given the lack of facilities and small room size. Upon checking out I was informed that the rate had changed to €119 and there was nothing I could do about it. The manageress had a very couldn´t care less attitude when I questioned this sudden increase and offered no solution or discount. The hotel has no competition in the area at present and so I guess feel they can do and charge whatever they like. I would not recomend the hotel and far better accomodation can be obtained in Madrid where better facilities are available.

HotelInfo.Name: Novotel Madrid Sanchinarro
HotelInfo.Address: Sanchinarro 15 | Km 5-7 de la Autopista A1, 28050 Madrid, Spain
